channel.title: Chaos Pickaxe
channel.description:
Well, I haven't done any models in a LONG time. So, I've decided to start one up. I'm going to be using the tracing method so that's what's happening. Here is my progress so far.
Flat version: http://www.mediafire.com/?lwnmknywovt
[size=20pt]ALL COLOR:[/size] [IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/14mh093.png[/img]
[size=20pt]SOME COLOR:[/size] [IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/2pri51u.png[/img]
[size=20pt]FRAMEWORK:[/size] [IMG]http://i43.tinypic.com/29ekk1z.png[/img] [IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/25a7ls4.png[/img] [IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/121sxtz.png[/img]

item.title: Chaos Pickaxe
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

no offence but it hardly looks like a pickaxe, more like a type of small scythe or a throwing axe, good job otherwise.

Read full topic

item.title: Chaos Pickaxe
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

http://www.mediafire.com/?lwnmknywovt

Releasing the flat version, if anyone would care to make it 3D. Go for it, I’ll put it at the top of the thread and give you credits.

Read full topic

item.title: Chaos Pickaxe
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

[quote=“tobias222, post:9, topic:281240”]Pretty damn epic!
Can you release with ints?[/quote]
he could if it was not flat…then again he still can just look weird and very nice but ye the handle wont be to hard what you should of done is do differatn parts at a time and add them all together so it wont be as hard to get 3D.

item.title: Chaos Pickaxe
item.dc:creator: @wayzey wayzey
item.description:
@wayzey wrote:

[quote=“cocoa, post:4, topic:281240”][quote author=wayzey link=topic=371386.msg2806032#msg2806032 date=1243730032]
You should think about how ur going to make certain bits round cause atm if you just colour that it’ll be a square lol.

Oh and btw, way too many points. You should think about using primitive editing to make the handle.
[/quote]
Alright so like a cylinder for the handle? Then just edit some pieces of it to make it look like what the points are.[/quote]

Yer try some primitive modelling in meta for the handle. It’s pretty easy.

Also with the blade, you should make it curve in to a point more near the end, whether thats the point or the side of the blade is up to you. It is a pickaxe so i’m going to assume it’s the point.

Read full topic
